briefdescription.para: Internal definition of a function that can instantiate objects that have been created with the BArchivable API.
Internal function that searches for the instantiation func that works on the specified archive. Use instantiate_object() instead.
Internal function that searches for the instantiation func of a specific class. Use instantiate_object() instead.
Internal function that searches for the instantiation func with a specific signature. Use instantiate_object() instead.

detaileddescription.para: This global function will determine the base class, based on the from argument, and it will call the Instantiate() function of that object to restore it.

simplesect.para: The object returns a pointer to the instantiated object, or NULL if the instantiation failed. The global errno variable will contain the reason why it failed.

briefdescription.para: Instantiate an archived object with the object being defined in a different application or library.

detaileddescription.para: This function is similar to instantiate_object(BMessage *from), except that it takes the id argument referring to an image where the object might be stored.

simplesect.para: Images are names for executable files. Image id's refer to these executable files that have been loaded by your application. Have a look at the kernel API for further information.

briefdescription.para: Internal function that checks if the className is the same as the one stored in the from message.
Provides the BArchivable interface and declares the BArchiver and BUnarchiver classes.
